intro: Sanicula nevadensis var. septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern sanicle, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbel-like clusters, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of montane and subalpine ecosystems.
